definition: college entrance exam (especially as abbr. for 普通高等學校招生全國統一考試|普通高等学校招生全国统一考试[Pu3 tong1 Gao1 deng3 Xue2 xiao4 Zhao1 sheng1 Quan2 guo2 Tong3 yi1 Kao3 shi4])/(Tw) entrance exam for senior government service posts (abbr. for 公務人員高等考試|公务人员高等考试)
high/tall/above average/loud/your (honorific)
surname Gao
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father

sentences.english: Written expression is an important test content in English entrance examination questions.
sentences.chinese: 书面表达题是高考英语试题中的一项重要测试内容。

sentences.english: While gaokao fever is as strong as ever this year, criticism is mounting.
sentences.chinese: 虽然今年的高考热一如既往，但批评声音也越来越多。

sentences.english: "The immigrants for NCEE" is a long-standing phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 国际高考移民现象由来已久。

sentences.english: I have a question about English. Help me!
sentences.chinese: 谁给我提供几篇高考英语作文范文？

sentences.english: Fan argued that the exam system stunts individual interests and talents.
sentences.chinese: 范谊认为，高考抹杀了学生的个性和天赋。

sentences.english: Students attend college entrance exam at a middle school in Shenyang, Liaoning Province.
sentences.chinese: 辽宁沈阳的一所中学内，学生们正在进行高考。

sentences.english: This paper talks about some test-taking strategies for English writing in NMT from several aspects.
sentences.chinese: 本文从几个方面谈论了高考英语书面表达的备考策略。

sentences.english: The suspected cheating took place during this year's entrance exams.
sentences.chinese: 这起可疑的作弊事件发生在今年的高考中。

sentences.english: But I think it's more difficult for Chinese students to study because of The College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 但我以为由于高考，中国的青年们会愈加难学。

sentences.english: The policy meaning of resuming college entrance examinations is still glistening.
sentences.chinese: 恢复高考的政策意义迄今依然熠熠生辉。

sentences.english: This is a new dictionary. I bought it yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 这是一本新词高考资源网典，我昨天买的。

sentences.english: Congratulations on your success in the National College Entrance Examination.
sentences.chinese: 祝贺您今年高考旗开得胜，金榜题名。

sentences.english: Entered Ningbo University, one of 211 Universities of China, I chose Biotechnology without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 高考填志愿选专业时，我毫不犹豫选了“生物”。

sentences.english: Objective To analyze the factors which influence College Enterance Examinees filling the aspiration forms.
sentences.chinese: 目的对影响高考考生填报决策的因素进行探析。

sentences.english: A： Do something about your English, or you’ll fail the college entrance exam.
sentences.chinese: 你的英语该加把劲了，不然你的高考会失败的。

sentences.english: The students find it difficult to cope with the syllabus of AL Physics.
sentences.chinese: 这些学生觉得高考物理科委实很难应付得好。

definition: entrance exam for senior middle school
to take an exam/exam/CL:次[ci4]
entrance examination
to enter the next grade school
unified examination
final exam
to sit an entrance exam for a graduate program
(of an audio device) to repeat a recorded phrase (e.g. for language learning)
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
grade/exam mark
to beat/to hit/variant of 考[kao3]/to inspect/to test/to take an exam
to check/to verify/to test/to examine/to take an exam/to take an entrance exam for/deceased father
student who repeats (a course, grade etc) at school
(an appendix, note etc) for reference
to pass a university entrance exam
unified examination (e.g. across the country)
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
to review/revision/CL:次[ci4]
exam candidate/student whose name has been put forward for an exam
